google_play_reviews.content: Amazing app, simple yet functional, works like a charm, weighs nonthing, loads lightining fast! Really a blast among overloaded apps in this segment. Thank you!
Works as expected.
The food prices there are to high.service is from your friendly staff is unmatched. The quailty and veriety is top notch

An excellent app, easy to use and view, without the interference of ads. Two requests. First, could you provide an option to password-protect entry into the app? That would add security if someone were to enter my phone. Second, would it be possible for you to add photo-capture of front and back of cards? These would truly make it a five-star app. Congratulations on the excellent work so far.
This is a very handy app and is easy to use. I recommend it to keep your loyalty cards in one place.

I rarely leave reviews, but the lack of a good, ad free and trusted open source loyalty card wallet that allows the user to make local backups is non-existent. This app could be AWESOME if you can PLEASE add the ability to store pictures of the front and back of the cards. This would allow us to store other cards like insurance cards, etc in addition to bar coded ones and not worry about having our info out on the cloud to be stolen. I promise I will sing your praises and update my review!
Like the integration with Google Drive :)

Haven't tested app at stores yet, but it was SUPER EASY to get all the cards in the app! Things can be saved in categories IF you use store name as Category such as Drugstore, and note field as store name such as CVS. Then all Drugstores are listed together.

Simple and efficient procedure to add a new card - any loyalty card, or edit its appearance or code. No ads (for now, at least)! Just what I was hoping for in my attempts with some other apps of this kind. Eventually, custom order of the cards could be enabled and some graphical help (illustration) of the terms in the Settings because there are several very similar terms and some illustration of their definition would help. But even if nothing else is done, it beats many other apps.
Does exactly what I want. No need to create an account or input irrelevant info.
Requires barcodes instead of just photographing the card so useless.
No internet account. Backup is present. Can edit card any time, any property.
Exactly what I was looking for. Now I can save so much room in my wallet, and feel very tech savvy when I check out at my favorite stores! Free, simple, no ads: the way good apps should be!
I use Catima nowadays and like that one better....
I like the simplicity, no ads, and very limited permissions. It would be nice to be able to pin cards to the top of list.
Simple format, easy to use!
Like the app, it is easy to use and simple in its format. Also like you can choose a color for each header.
Perfect! Simple to set up, simple to use. Does the one thing I want it to do (store my loyalty card data), doesn't try to do anything else. THANK YOU FOR THIS!!!!!
Easy to use and no ads. What's not to like. One thought - how about an option to choose the order they are displayed rather than just alphabetically ?? Great work üëç
Great
Just what I needed and nothing else: scan, store, display. No ads, just perfect.

Seems to be a good app, but having issues trying to add a widget - drag the widget to the screen, but all it does is open the app when i drop it - ie doesn't actually add the widget to the screen. Using pixel 3/Android 11/Nova launcher
My wallet is half the thickness than before. I love this app.
Super simple. Now, I have all of my cards in one, convenient place. Thank you!
The app design is ok, however, it cannot capture the membership card from image, it makes the app difficult to use, since most of the membership card is in eformat

Useless. Apps like this dont work with laser scanners ie: 95% of stores. All of these loyalty card holding apps are Unless. There was only one app that worked beep'ngo. But Samsung shut them down. Dont waste Your time

Great app, easy to use and straight forward. Only thing missing is ability to sort cards into a custom order or into any order other than alphabetical, I'd like to order my cards in most used or most likely to use order. Can be done with numerals in the card name but that's not an elegant solution.
Works, wish it made a smaller barcode at the top of the display, so the gas pump scanner at the Kroger filling station could pick it up a bit easier...
Useful tool to get rid of all the plastic cards from my wallet. Can tap on the code to slide the barcode to one end of the screen (necessary to slide into my library's barcode scanner slot.)
Wonderful loyalty card barcode keeper app.
Perfect app! Hour of searching through bloatware and adware and many user-unfriendly apps. Thank you!
Excellent cards managing app! Plus, it's open source! :D
Super easy and I don't have a million of those little plastic things hanging on my keychain

This app was great until my cell phone screen blow out and I had to get a new phone. The app picture is on my phone BUT ALL MY KEY CHAIN CODES ARE GONE! IT'S EMPTY, AND I DISGARDED THE PHYSICAL TAGS! I'M SCREWED! Does anyone know if its possible to retrive them?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear that your phone died. This app does not upload your data anywhere, so there is not backup from the app itself. If you have a general Android backup solution, such as Google's, the app data should be backed up. Other than that, if you happened to export your cards with the app's export option you can import the backup file to restore.

google_play_reviews.content: Barcode scanner is not working
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Having trouble getting the barcode scanner working? Feel free to email me and I can try to help.

google_play_reviews.content: So far so good, thank you so much and keep up with the good work.üëçüëåüëèüôÇ, I really love this app üòç. Please don't change this app please üôè.
One of the most useful app I have on my phone. And although it seems quite a simple thing adding a database to a card scanner, there are only a couple of spammy apps offering the functionality.
I like this app, especially the privacy. A better widget interface would be good.

No BS app Like others loyalty apps. This is it for my cards. Add web page field and something like taking pictures of cards and cropping them for card logo. Barcode reader can successful scan all of my cards. Nice little add free app.
This doesn't work at self serve checkouts. You need to fix this problem.
Open source, device storage, simple with no bloat. Very well done and thought out.

It looks like a good start but I don't get what's so awesome about it currently. Useless without front & back photo snapshots. Plus a way to export /backup would be excellent (though very few cards apps I've seen has this feature so I'm not knocking this project for lack of it).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. There is no support for the front/back photos currently, however the import/export functionality is available from the main app view -- click on the menu overflow button and select Import/Export.

google_play_reviews.content: I like the App but would love to have a QR code option too.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. I believe that the app does support QR codes. Are you having difficulty creating a card that uses a QR code? If so, feel free to email me if you have a question.

google_play_reviews.content: Does one thing and do it well. Excellent.
The barcode scanner st CBS wouldn't recognize or was unable to scan the barcode displayed by this app. Therefore, it's useless.

This app is awesome and truly useful. Thank you dev for your work! The new dark mode is truly useful, however I would appreciate if you added a "true black mode" for AMOLED displays. Keep up the great work!
It's SO nice to use one small app, with minimal permissions, to manage all my barcode- and qr-based cards.
Exactly what I needed after Google Pay made it harder and harder to save loyalty cards for small businesses like my local gym. Thank you!

Card information is easy to enter. The user interface is simple, efficient and to the point. I like that the app uses minimal permissions (no network access needed) and doesn't bombard me with advertisements.

I recently had to upgrade my trusty Note 4. Barclone, an app that I had used for loyalty cards is no longer maintained and its backup restore function no longer works. Loyalty Card Keychain is everything I was looking for in a replacement: ad-free, local backups, low footprint, scan and manual capture options, flexible UI ... with a card capture facility that is better than the app I had been using. And it thus far has performed flawlessly. I'm very pleased.

Simple and straightforward local storage, no unnecessary cloud account, no junk or ads and totally free. Five stars! Would appreciate the possibility to add a little (company) image/logo/icon to each card that would be visible in the card listing, for a more fancy look of the cards

Awesome app, love the simplicity and the fact that is not cloud oriented as I value my privacy _VERY_ much. One major improvement, IMHO, would be some sorting options, like "custom" or "frequency of use".

I haven't had to carry a wallet since installing this excelent App, brilliant. Clean simple interface, tiny memory footprint (between only 12 & 30% that of the higher rated competition!), & free! Would have given 5 stars if it would facilitate customisation of list order (displays cards in alphabetical order only). I will contact the dev with this suggestion, & happily upgrade rating to 5 stars should they impliment it.
It needs cloud sync to other devices
ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤

I had to get a new app after my previous one wouldn't work after my phone upgrade. Downloaded three different apps of this type and this was the easy winner. Simple interface, easy to upload all my cards, and nothing fancy. A few cards added a number or letter at the end (easily edited), and it was weird having to select the style of scanning code (makes me nervous if I did it right), so we'll see how it works in practice.
works great and requires minimal permissions

Excellente application! L√©g√®re, sauvegarde facile, partage possible, tr√®s rapide, n'utilise pas les donn√©es. I miss possibility to add an image or a complete photo of the real card, but thank you anyway!
Very simple and works as expected. Supports 1-d barcodes and QR codes, per what I have tested.
Simple and ad-free.

Plus: Lightweight, quick, open source, not sharing info with 3rd parties, and import and export of data to allow easy transfer. Small minus: Would be nice if images of front and back could be scanned and stored in the app / scanned logos used as IDs in user interface.

Installed and having a problem with a scanned card. I tried today to use my phone instead of the card and it wouldn't scan properly. We proceeded entering the numbers manually and realized that a one was added to the card number. Needs to be fixed. Update. It seems it was only the Air Miles card as all the other cards are okay. Manually corrected the Air Miles card with me bar code. Thanks DEVS for a good app with no ads and respect for privacy.
Just missing an option to keep screen on (awake)
Great app to get a lighter wallet
Perfect. No ads, it's fast and doesn't have you standing in line waiting for the info to pull up to give to the cashier like Stocard did.... Nice job!!!
Can I delete previosly saved cards?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, you can delete previously saved cards. When looking at a card there will be a pencil icon in the menu. Click on that to edit the card. From there, in the overflow menu (...) there is an option to delete.

google_play_reviews.content: Nice simple app. It would be much more useful if it captured and store the front and back of the card. That's the main reason for 3 stars not 4 or 5
Does what it says well. No ads, small size. Developers react blazingly fast. You can share or backup your cards via files. Best I managed to find
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for reporting the barcode entering issue. That is a regression in v0.25. A fix should be out later today.

google_play_reviews.content: great app and no sharing of data. thanks for making this open source. i like the easy bar code scanning and was able to upload 10 of my loyalty and library cards easily.
Simple and gets the job done.  Thanks for creating this.
Awesome. Simple and to the point. I wish it could remember when i click on the block/unblock rotation button, instead of clicking everytime i open the card.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I agree. Today I gave my phone to a clerk and watched him try to scan the barcode, turning and rotating the phone many times. The orientation was not locked, so it just rotated over and over instead of scanning. A setting was added today which will force the orientation lock. This will appear in the next release. Thanks for the suggestion.

google_play_reviews.content: Weird and access üëé
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Could you clarify what you mean? Is "access" the optional storage permission for backing up data? "Weird" is subjective, so if you have any constructive criticism, feel free to let me know in a review or via email.

google_play_reviews.content: This app does what it says with no frills. It replaced similar app that took a long time to open and had features I didn't use.
Simple, no BS app. Works as advertised. Thanks, devs.

It works, Small foot print, Straight to the point, No ads. It is missing 
two features that I would like... 1) to set the icon of a card to an image 
(either photo or file), and 2) when the phone is rotated 90 degrees to only 
show the barcode (this for difficult readers). But, I still gave 5 stars 
because of the small foot print and no ads.

Free, no ads and no bloat. The perfect app for storing my loyalty cards on 
my phone. Now, I just have to tap the card and show it to the cashier.
Simple and quick to use. Stored all my cards in 10 mins.

Simple. Clean. Intuitive. No fuss. No ads. No extras. An electronic key tag 
app. Absolutely perfect!

Absolutely fantastic app. No bloat, no annoying notifications or unwanted 
features. Nice, simple barcode keychain. I love it

Very useful app, unfortunately, the fixed product scanners with the glass 
window on the table can't seem to read barcodes on OLED displays, but 
that's not the app's fault. Hand scanners do work but not all stores have 
them, in my case, that's Edeka.
Barcord not scanning
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Could you email me with more information? I typically do not have difficulties scanning barcodes, so I would like to learn what you are running into. Thanks

google_play_reviews.content:
Compact, simple, does the job and doesn't even try to be more than it is. 
No ads, no unneeded permissions, no BS. Perfection!
Open source
Light and excellent app. Responsive developer. Thanks!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Good idea. Check out v0.14, which has support for app shortcuts (Android 7.1+) and a widget (Android 4.2+), and see if it helps! If you have any feedback, feel free to send me an email.

google_play_reviews.content: Perfect app! the improvements the dev has been adding are awesome. thanks for pointing out where the import/export is.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. As for backup/restore, try tapping the up/down arrow menu option at the main app screen. There you will find a menu for backing up and restoring your cards. If you have other suggestions, feel free to send me an email.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and efficient without strange permissions and ads. Just perfect.
No invasive permissions. Simple. Perfect.
Great APP. Fully doing what promised. No ads. No weird permissions.

Simple app. Lets you choose the type of barcode you want to use. No ads and is free. Would like to see a database of retailer logos as similar apps have done that would appear alongside the bar code. This would help assure you have chosen the correct loyalty card.

Does exactly what it needs to. I make heavy use of it.   Feature you could add: the widget icons don't conform to my icon pack and can't be changed. Ummm... I can't think of anything else. How refreshing would that be: an app that does everything you need, and then it's done!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. About the widget icon request, do you know of an app which has a widget icon/shortcut that is configurable? If so, send me an email, and I'll take a look.

google_play_reviews.content: Doesnt work at all
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sorry that you were unable to use the app. Would you be willing to give me more information about what you are seeing, so I can try to address it? If so, please send me an email: protect.github@gmail.com.

google_play_reviews.content: The app might be simple but it does what it was built for, and it privacy is important to you then you will love this app as it won't collect your location, no account needed, no ads to worry about, no weird phone permissions to worry about. Thank you for the great app
Unable to change the card number and unable to remove a store.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear that you had difficulty using the app. It may not be obvious, but if you open a card and click on the pencil icon at the top right it allows you to edit a card.  From there you can delete the card from the menu or press "Edit Card" or "Capture Card" to change the card. Hope this helps.

google_play_reviews.content: It works. Would be nice to keep scan of cards like beep n go. And backup to Google drive...but otherwise good.
Open source, ad-free, free app. Would be cool to store image of a card.

Brilliant app! No need to create an account, no hastle, just name, optional note, then scan or enter number manually. Love it.  Small suggestion would be to allow us to select a card logo or colour. Maybe a colour selector when creating a card that changes a highlight colour in the list and/or the background colour when displaying the barcode.  Also, my IKEA family card is 20odd digits long but the barcode image ends up quite crushed from the sides, and rotating it to landscape does not stretch it. Meaning it's hard to get the reader to read it
I was looking for something simple, ad free, lightweight and functional to store my loyalty cards. Also, there is an option to export/backup your cards into a csv file. It's perfect! Thank you guys!
I see nothing what happen can you help me out here I missed something the barcode doesn't show up when I click on the app it's asking me to start again
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please send me an email with details; I'll be happy to help determine the issue.

google_play_reviews.content: Love it. Minimal permissions, no data harvesting, clean simple interface, "just works." Other apps should learn from this one as an example.
Great app so far. Just a question. What's that lock icon on the top right?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Some of the features are not easy to discover, sorry about that. The lock icon will prevent the screen from rotating when the phone is rotated. This results in less awkward interactions when handing the phone to someone at a store to scan a barcode. Otherwise, the phone may rotate and the barcode may change where it is located.

google_play_reviews.content: FANTASTIC APP. Love that it's open source, no ads, no permissions that takes your user data, super compact, simple. One thing I'd like to see added is color-options. This is purely for aesthetics. I work in a library which accepts digital library cards that can be read by our scanners. Color scheme options could make the app much more appealing to patrons.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you clarify what you mean by color options? Feel free to send me an email with more details.

google_play_reviews.content: Widget text color is wrong, nice simple app otherwise but the widget doesn't stick to the standard android font of white text with a black outline, the text is all black so barely readable to be able to tell which card is which
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Proper shortcut handling is now available in v0.15. That should resolve the issue. Take a look and let me know if you have any feedback.

google_play_reviews.content: Looks ok. Unable to import .png image of card, generic error message with no clues as to how to troubleshoot/resolve.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review and feedback. Currently the app does not have support for importing pictures of cards. Instead, it can backup/restore data in CSV format, which is a type of text file. If you have additional feedback, feel free to send me an email.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app! Congratulations!
No ads, data usage or laundry list of permissions trying to collect data from all my social media accounts.  Only want it to do 1 thing, and that's what it does well.
Light weight and Open Source for the win.

Simple and small app so great in those regards. One question... when adding a widget, the text is black which is hard to see against my dark wallpaper - text on all my other apps is white - can that be fixed?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you send me an email with a screenshot of the widget against the dark background so I can see what you mean? From there I can look into it. Thanks! (Update: The issue should be addressed in v0.15).

google_play_reviews.content: A no frills Loyalty/Gift Card app that does one thing and does it well.

The best loyalty card app that is the smallest in size (3 vs 15 mb) with the lowest permission requests (only camera to take pictures of the card, and the sd card). Love it! Keep up the good work guys!
App not able to save the cards that are photographed, hence app uninstalled pronto
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you elaborate on the issue you are seeing? You have a photo of a barcode, but the app could not scan it? If you are interested in providing more details, please send me an email.

google_play_reviews.content: No dubious permissions required and works excellently.
Thank you for the pre-populate improvement in editing cards.
